did.head: Collection Overview

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo.Music Library

did.abstract: The Pamela Gearhart Papers contain a biographical summary, curriculum vitae, correspondence, newspaper clippings, and programs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Pamela Gearhart Papers, 1956-1993, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Pamela Gearhart 2007; additions received in 2015 as a gift from the estate of Pamela Gearhart.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Gabrielle A. Carlo 2012; additions processed by John Bewley 2017 and 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pamela Gearhart (née Gerhart) was born July 21, 1934 in Altoona, Pennsylvania. She began her musical training with her father, violinist and conductor, Russell Gerhart. Russell Gerhart studied violin with Ralph Lewando, Carl Malcherek, Elias Breeskin, and Mischa Mischakoff. He studied conducting with Serge Koussevitsky at the Berkshire Music Center. Gerhart and his wife Martha formed the Gerhart String Ensemble in Altoona, Pennsylvania, which grew into the Altoona Symphony Orchestra. He also served as conductor of the Saint Louis Philharmonic and Huntsville (Alabama) Civic Symphony.

When Pamela Gearhart was fifteen she began five years of study at the Curtis Institute of Music in Philadelphia. Her violin teachers before and after her years at Curtis were Mischa Mischakoff, Joseph Knitzer, Ivan Galamian and Efrem Zimbalist. While at Curtis she performed in the Curtis Orchestra under conductors Alexander Hilsberg and William Smith, and studied chamber music performance with Karen Tuttle and Marcel Tabuteau.

Gearhart was appointed faculty member in the University of Buffalo Music Department in 1957. Initially she was hired as a part-time instructor in violin but eventually assumed other duties, including conducting the university's orchestra and directing the program in chamber music performance. She continued to work at the University at Buffalo until 1975. Pamela Gearhart married fellow University at Buffalo music faculty member Livingston Gearhart in 1955. They were frequent collaborators on programs and projects. Livingston wrote many musical arrangements geared specifically to the pedagogical needs of Pamela's ensembles. Many of these arrangements and compositions survive in the Livingston Gearhart Score Collection.

While in Buffalo Gearhart also served as conductor of the Community Music School of Buffalo's youth orchestra 1959-1977. The membership in the orchestra grew from ten to more than one hundred while she was conductor. Her credentials as a music educator also include work on the faculty at Villa Maria Institute of Music (Buffalo) 1963-1965, serving for six years as Alexander Schneider's assistant for the University at Buffalo's String Institute, numerous positions as guest conductor and judge at music festivals, and director of the Youth Makes Music String Workshop (Huntsville, Alabama). After leaving the University at Buffalo she joined the faculty at Ithaca College where she taught 1975-1993. In 1980 she founded the Ithaca Youth Orchestra. She continued as its conductor until her retirement from Ithaca College. Pamela Gearhart died July 6, 2014 in Rochester, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Pamela Gearhart Papers contain brief biographical data, including a biographical summary from 1967, and curriculum vitae from 1971. Also included are clippings, programs, and correspondence. Clippings and programs extend from 1956-1982 and reflect Gearhart's work with the Community Music School of Buffalo, the University at Buffalo Orchestra, the Villa Maria Music Institute, her performances as a member of the Buffalo Fine Arts Quartet, and various other performances. One folder contains programs and clippings chiefly about Livingston Gearhart. Two folders contain documents pertaining to the Youth Makes Music String Workshop that was held in Alabama 1972-1981, a string camp established in memory of Russell Gerhart.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in four series:

item.ref: IV. Youth Makes Music String Workshop documents
V. Additions received after the original processing was completed

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, clippings, programs, lecture notes, and subject files.

arrangement.p:
Arranged into four subseries:
A. Correspondence
B. Subject files
C. Clippings and programs
D. Lecture and presentation notes
E. Awards

scopecontent.p: Includes letter from Efrem Zimbalist to Pamela Gearhart's father, Russell Gerhart.

About brothers Andrew and Thomas Wolf, founders of the Bay Chamber Concerts in Rockport, Maine.

One binder with contents as received.

Notes for presentations with the strings of the University at Buffalo Orchestra (1970) and the Ithaca College String Orchestra (1976).

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Thirty photographs received with the collection were removed to form a separate collection. It was later expanded to include 207 photographs.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Pamela Gearhart Photograph Collection, 1957-1997 Mus. Arc. 33.1
defitem.item: The collection contains 207 photographs, including images of Russell, Gerhart, Franco Autori, Claudette Sorel, Edward Murphy, Mischa Mischakoff, Livingston Gearhart, Alexander and Mischa Schneider, Skitch Henderson, and Pamela Gearhart.

defitem.label: Livingston Gearhart Papers, 1933-1997 Mus. Arc. 23.1
defitem.item: The collection contains prose writings, vitae, correspondence, teaching materials, programs, and clippings.

defitem.label: Livingston Gearhart Recordings, 1949-2001 Mus. Arc. 23.4
defitem.item: The collection contains reel to reel and cassette tapes, compact discs, and LPs containing music composed or arranged by Livingston Gearhart.
